content.shortDescription: Follow a band of exiles on their monumental journey to save humanity and rebuild civilization amid the fall of the Galactic Empire.
content.title: Foundation

textRecommendations.headline: A show for people who love puzzles and like being confused
textRecommendations.body: If you like puzzles, if you like figuring stuff out, if you like to be confused and even sometimes surprised by what you see, and have no idea how it all is gonna turn out, you should watch Foundation.
textRecommendations.bodyHTML: If you like puzzles, if you like figuring stuff out, if you like to be confused and even sometimes surprised by what you see, and have no idea how it all is gonna turn out, you should watch Foundation.

profile.bio: Terrence Mann is an acclaimed actor and baritone singer known for his brilliant Broadway performances. Making his debut on Broadway in 1980, he has had an illustrious career on stage, starring in iconic shows like “Cats”, “Les Miserables”, “Beauty and the Beast”, “Pippin”, “The Rocky Horror Show”, and more. On screen, he is known for roles in “Critters” (1986), “A Chorus Line” (1985), and “Big Top Pee-wee” (1988). His leading performance as Brother Dusk in the sci-fi television show “Foundation” (2021) demonstrates the considerable acting skill that has underpinned his entire career.

textRecommendations.headline: A sci-fi epic that’s never been done on TV before
textRecommendations.body: “Foundation” is a sci-fi epic in a way that’s never been done on TV before. The characters are incredible, it’s interesting, it’s fun, it’s funny, it’s sad, it’s heartbreaking, and it’s got a bit of everything for everyone. So if you want something seriously entertaining, put on Foundation. I also really connected with the script and my character when I read it. I love playing someone so intelligent and amazing. She started kind of shy, but she’s evolved so much in these three seasons and now she’s become this amazing leader.
textRecommendations.bodyHTML: “Foundation” is a sci-fi epic in a way that’s never been done on TV before. The characters are incredible, it’s interesting, it’s fun, it’s funny, it’s sad, it’s heartbreaking, and it’s got a bit of everything for everyone. So if you want something seriously entertaining, put on Foundation. I also really connected with the script and my character when I read it. I love playing someone so intelligent and amazing. She started kind of shy, but she’s evolved so much in these three seasons and now she’s become this amazing leader.

profile.bio: Lou Llobell is an actress known for her roles in exciting sci-fi titles. She starred as Zandie in the movie “Voyagers” (2021), which saw her act alongside the likes of Colin Farrell and Lily-Rose Depp. Her career skyrocketed when she was cast in the lead role of Gaal Dornick in the multi-season television series “Foundation” (2021).

textRecommendations.headline: A sci-fi show that will hook hardcore fans and non-fans alike
textRecommendations.body: Do you like maximalist sci-fi? If you do…I got a show for you! Do you like shows where the story spans 300 years? Do you like robots, people sleeping through centuries? “Foundation” has lots of ways for someone to find a hook into it. Sci-fi fans usually like sci-fi things, so they’ll enjoy the show, but I’d also really encourage anyone who doesn’t consider themselves sci-fi fans to try it out.
textRecommendations.bodyHTML: Do you like maximalist sci-fi? If you do…I got a show for you! Do you like shows where the story spans 300 years? Do you like robots, people sleeping through centuries? “Foundation” has lots of ways for someone to find a hook into it. Sci-fi fans usually like sci-fi things, so they’ll enjoy the show, but I’d also really encourage anyone who doesn’t consider themselves sci-fi fans to try it out.

profile.bio: Lee Pace is a stage and screen actor known for memorable roles in major franchises such as King Thranduil in The Hobbit trilogy, Ronan the Accuser in the MCU’s “Guardians of the Galaxy” (2014) and “Captain Marvel” (2019), and Garrett in “The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn Part 2” (2012). His performances in cult classics such as “The Fall” (2006), “Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day” (2008), and “A Single Man” (2009) have won him critical acclaim and proven his incredible range. He’s also known for a variety of characters on the small screen, from his outstanding portrayal of Ned in “Pushing Daisies” (2007) all the way to his magnetic performance as Brother Day in “Foundation” (2021). No matter the size or style of the role, Lee Pace brings a unique gravitas to the screen

textRecommendations.headline: Huge and grand with great visuals, but also layered, complex and human
textRecommendations.body: In “Foundation” the galaxy is huge and grand, but inside that there are these interesting, layered characters who are forced into difficult relationships that have strange dynamics between them. For me, that’s what I really love about the show. “Foundation” has grandeur and great visuals, but also these difficult relationships and complex human connections.
textRecommendations.bodyHTML: In “Foundation” the galaxy is huge and grand, but inside that there are these interesting, layered characters who are forced into difficult relationships that have strange dynamics between them. For me, that’s what I really love about the show. “Foundation” has grandeur and great visuals, but also these difficult relationships and complex human connections.

profile.bio: Laura Birn started her career with the comedy “Pearls and Pigs” (2003) and went on to win praise for her role as Aliide Truu in the Finnish drama “Purge” (2012), while also taking on roles in romantic dramas, action thrillers, historical biographies, and more. She is known for her leading role in “Helene” (2020), where she portrayed famed Finnish painter Helene Schjerfbeck, and her performances in “A Walk Among the Tombstones” (2014) and “The Crow” (2024). She has garnered much acclaim for her portrayal of the android Demerzel in the epic sci-fi series, “Foundation” (2021), and is among the most well-regarded Finnish actors working today.

textRecommendations.headline: Small-screen sci-fi with big-screen spectacle
textRecommendations.body: This show combines all of the best parts of sci-fi. You get this incredible scope and scale you might get from a movie like “2001: A Space Odyssey,” but at the same time, you have interesting questions about AI you might get from Alex Garland’s movies. There are many elements of mysticism reminiscent of the Dune franchise. So if you’re a sci-fi fan and love cinema, this is the show for you. Nothing about “Foundation” feels like it was made for the small screen, this is absolutely a big-screen spectacle.
textRecommendations.bodyHTML: This show combines all of the best parts of sci-fi. You get this incredible scope and scale you might get from a movie like “2001: A Space Odyssey,” but at the same time, you have interesting questions about AI you might get from Alex Garland’s movies. There are many elements of mysticism reminiscent of the Dune franchise. So if you’re a sci-fi fan and love cinema, this is the show for you. Nothing about “Foundation” feels like it was made for the small screen, this is absolutely a big-screen spectacle.

profile.bio: Cassian Bilton is a British actor who has featured in many award-winning short films, including “The Devil’s Harmony” (2019) and “Shoal” (2020). He is known for his heart-wrenching performance as Brother Dawn in the epic sci-fi show, “Foundation” (2021), where he portrays multiple iterations of this character across hundreds of years. He has performed on stage at Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre and is also a singer interested in the arts.

textRecommendations.headline: An epic space fantasy that unfolds over a thousand years
textRecommendations.body: Do you want to get lost in an epic space fantasy that unfolds over a thousand years and involves the future fate of mankind? Then I think you’ll love Foundation.
textRecommendations.bodyHTML: Do you want to get lost in an epic space fantasy that unfolds over a thousand years and involves the future fate of mankind? Then I think you’ll love Foundation.

profile.bio: Jared Harris has the uncanny ability that all great screen performers have: they are simultaneously recognizable and yet utterly transformed into their character. From the doomed Russian scientist Valery Legasov in “Chernobyl” (2019) to stiff Brit abroad Lane Pryce in “Mad Men” (2009-20212), Jared Harris has a talent for complex characters. He has starred as iconic figures both fictional and historical, including James Moriarty in “Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows” (2011), Ulysses S. Grant in “Lincoln” (2012), King George VI in “The Crown” (2016-17), and Andy Warhol in “I Shot Andy Warhol” (1996). His leading role as the prophetic scientist Hari Seldon in the television series “Foundation” (2021–) sees him bring his skill and experience to Isaac Asimov’s sci-fi universe.

content.title: Foundation’s End
content.shortDescription: Chaos and destruction rain down on New Terminus. Back on Trantor, Dusk and Quent unite to assess the state of the galaxy.
